title: Typographic Fast Type Slow Type Revs
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/vmonster_6357.jpg)
  
Vincent Connare - Ducati Monster S2R  
===========================================

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/multistrada_6609.jpg)
  
Joe Pemberton - Ducati Multistrada 620  
===========================================

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/prd_bike_achilles_black_metallic_4372.jpg)
  
Clive Bruton - Honda Pan European  
===========================================

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/porchezcrowd%20scene_4358.jpg)
  
Jean Francois Porchez - Lambretta old school  
===========================================
author: vinceconnare

comments.content:
City boys get around faster!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/littleduc_3770.jpg)

[and so do little guys!](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/comfortfirst.com/p-35127-peg-perego-ducati-monster-motorcycle-ride-on-toy-free-shipping.aspx)

Come on boys and girls what 2 wheels typo are riding?

No cars! or Buses! or trains! They are slow not [Fast type!](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/www.typevents.com/)

Ducati Multistrada: 53 MPG  
Honda Civic Hybrid: 42 MPG

Did you finally get the Monster? Did you trade in your Vespa?

You can add [Rich Roat](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rich%20Roat) ( [House](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/typophile.com/wiki/House%20Industries) Ind) who also rides a Ducati Multistrada (Silver). And there's [veryscary](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/veryscarygary/tags/motorcycle/) (from [Veer](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Veer)). What other lurking Typophiles get around on two wheels?

Here's my bike on Flickr: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/tags/multistrada/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/tags/multistrada/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/joepemberton/tags/multistrada/")

Vespa sold, Yamaha sold. Monster yes, that's a picture of my Monster.

my moto history:  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/sets/1771514/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/sets/1771514/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/93279914@N00/sets/1771514/")

I used to have a Yamaha Fazer (V-Max's little brother)  
in college. It got stolen. I had a Peugeot scooter then a  
Honda-80 back in Beirut. The latter got stolen. Twice.

hhp

OK guys, here is my speed burner:

ChrisL

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/drive-10210_5841.jpg)
cool two wheel naked streetfighter, what are those red things? the emergency engine stopper or turn indications?

'85 BMW R65

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bmwr65_3460.jpg)

This is the photo of it as it was unloaded off the truck onto my driveway, it has since undergone complete disassembly and overhaul with new black paint job. No pics on my laptop though.

"what are those red things? the emergency engine stopper or turn indications?"

Those are the hyperspeed thrusters dude! "We need morrre powerrr Captain!"

ChrisL

Fast type, Slow type Conference  
16-18 October 2006  
The Custard Factory, Birmingham, UK  
-----------------------------------

If you are booking for the Fast type, Slow type Conference  
make sure you take advantage of the early bird rates, which  
close on Tuesday 19 September 2006.

Early Bird Rates  
3-day ticket = £175.00  
2-day ticket = £120.00  
1-day ticket = £75.00  
Concessions (students, retired, unemployed) = £115.00

The price of a ticket includes:  
. 28 lectures  
. over 20 exhibitions  
. letterpress workshops  
. calligraphy sessions  
. guilding workshops  
. stone carving opportunities  
. a lesson in FF PicLig visual language  
. private viewing of the Plus international design expo  
. two parties  
and a limited edition booklet to commemorate the occasion.

Come to the conference and :  
. Take a walking tour of Baskerville's Birmingham  
. Have your 'Hands on Baskerville'  
. View the Baskerville exhibition at the Central Reference  
. Library  
. Listen to Jenny Uglow talk about 'Bewick and Bothersome  
Printers'  
. Book a seat for 'Pravda' at the Repertory Theatre

We look forward to welcoming you in Birmingham!  
. . . . . . . .

You can unsubscribe from the Friends of St Bride Library mailing list  
by sending us a blank message from the email account we reach you on.

Send it to:  
 [friends-announcements-unsubscribe@stbride.org](mailto:friends-announcements-unsubscribe@stbride.org)

We regret that no messages posted to this list will be acknowledged.  
Please use the forms on the St Bride Library web site at  
 [http://www.stbride.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101204155800/http:/www.stbride.org/ "http://www.stbride.org/") to contact the Friends or the Library staff.
